name: Mini Chicken Meatballs with Crispy Potatoes and Romesco
description: Mini Chicken Meatballs - super easy recipe made with chicken, breadcrumbs, Parm, garlic, eggs, salt. Served with crispy potatoes and a 5-minute Romesco sauce!
keywords: chicken meatballs, potatoes, romesco sauce, crispy potatoes
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 lb. baby golden yukon potatoes, cut into small bite sized pieces
Chimichurri sauce if you wanna get REALLY punchy

recipeInstructions.text: MEATBALLS: Combine all the meatball ingredients in a large bowl until well-mixed. Roll into small 2-bite balls and place on a large baking sheet. Add more breadcrumbs if necessary to get the mixture to hold its shape when rolled. Heat a little bit of olive oil in a large non-stick or heavy bottomed skillet over medium heat. Add the meatballs in batches and turn every few minutes until the exterior is golden brown and the inside is fully cooked.
POTATOES: In the same pan that you fried the meatballs, pan-fry the potatoes for about 10 minutes with a little more olive oil and salt. They should be golden brown and crispy when finished.

Serve the meatballs with the potatoes and any and all sauces you love. Namely, ROMESCO SAUCE. You can do the sauce hot or cold, and you can compliment it with a bright and herby finish like chimichurri or just a little extra lemon juice, salt, pepper, and Parmesan. If you do the sauce hot, I recommend simmering it first with a little bit of additional liquid to help it loosen up.

review.reviewBody: I was looking out for meat ball recipes and this one looks yummy. I did love to try this soon. Meat balls are my favorite and this post came up at the right time

I have to admit...I half expected tofu meatballs {umm make that happen please} before chicken meatballs...since it's been a hot minute since I have seen a chicken recipe here! :D  And TWO sauces??? Youre a wild woman and I LIKE IT woohoo!!
These mini chicken meatballs look so delicious!  Can't wait to try these!

I made this for dinner and added some greens to the potatoes in the last few minutes they were cooking. I used kale and it was delicious! Gave it a little green so it wasn't just meat and potatoes. Loved the recipe!

We made these for dinner last night and they were truly delicious.  I have very picky kids and they gobbled them all up, romesco sauce and all!  The only drawback to the recipe was that everyone was back in the kitchen an hour later looking for more food!  We split the recipe between 5 people, I served more veggies on the side but everyone was still starving an hour later!  Not sure this recipe would stretch to 8 people as it's not very filling?  Will definitely make again though, thanks.
These meatballs were DELICIOUS, and I have never before eaten a meatball I liked. We'll be making these again and again.

I made this last night and it was delicious!! I don't really like potatoes or chicken (made it with my husband in mind), but I loved it! I added parm to the sauce too! :) Can't get enough cheese...Shared the recipe with many friends already.
I really like your recipes because you have mentioned number of recipes that can be cooked at home, It would be waste of time if order kebab delivery without trying these recipes at home.
